definition: To express an idea or feeling fluently and coherently.
To form an opinion or supposition about something based on incomplete information.
To try to acquire or develop a quality, sentiment, or skill.
To make someone or something weak and infirm.
To make something clear; explain.
To make something more attractive by adding decorative details or features.
To make a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling worse.
To shock or excite someone into taking action.
To put something forward as a hypothesis.
To overwhelm someone with things or people to be dealt with.
To make less severe, serious, or painful.
To exclude someone from a society or group.
To spread throughout something; pervade.
To restore friendly relations between.
To examine or inspect closely and thoroughly.
To provide evidence to support or prove the truth of.
To suppose that something is true without having evidence to confirm it.
To go beyond the range or limits of (something abstract, typically a conceptual field or division).
To speak or write about in an abusively disparaging manner.
To clear someone of blame or suspicion.
